gauge 5 0 sts = 1 2 5 cm stockinette stitch blocked gauge is not critical but will affect the finished size and yardage requirements yarn used dragonfly fibers dragon sock 100% merino mermaid colorway yardage approximately 675-725 yds 617-663 m of fingering/sock weight yarn although yardage will vary based on individual knitting style needle size and yarn weight eresa rose is a richly textured top-down tttt triangular lace shawl with a modern geometric pattern of twisted stitches that pop out in relief on a reverse stockinette background although the body pattern appears complex it is very intuitive to knit and easy to memorize a pretty lace edge adorns the top of the wingspan a dramatic scalloped border with garter ridges atop centered double decreases complements the shawl body by adding textural interest while dimensions and yardage are provided for fingering weight teresa rose could also be worked in heavier weight yarn for an even more textured look teresa rose is a great shawl to showcase your favorite subtly- variegated hand-dyed or tonal yarns but it will also look fantastic knitted in solid colors the size is very easy to customize either by changing the number of chart 2 repeats worked by using a different yarn weight or both the pattern includes both written instructions and charts this shawl is dedicated to my fabulous mother teresa rose stubits although not a knitter herself she is fascinated by lace just like her daughter she has always encouraged my artistic pursuits be they crafty or musical in nature for which i am forever grateful as she approaches her ninth decade i am so proud of how she never stops challenging herself to learn and enjoy new things mom this one s for you teresa rose © 2014 by dee o keefe cid 1 dee okeefe@ymail com cid 1 dee o keefe designs ppppaaaatttttttteeeerrrrnnnn nnnnooootttteeeessss ppppaaaaggggeeee 2222 construction teresa rose starts with a provisional cast on at the center back of the neck the lace edge which adds a decorative touch at the top of the wingspan is worked simultaneously with the body a 2-stitch center spine separates each half the entire shawl is worked in one piece down to the scalloped border and then the lace edge is grafted together at the top of the neck patterning is worked on both right and wrong sides for the majority of the shawl needle size to achieve an appropriate texture
